resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/107682</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>107682</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770202815</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Shadows of North Carolina's Past (Archaeology)</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Schatten von Nord-Carolina hinter (Archäologie)</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Ombres de la Caroline du nord après 
(archéologie)</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Sombras de North.carolina após (archaeology)</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Ombre di North.carolina oltre (archaeology)</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Σκιές του παρελθόντος της βόρειας Καρολίνας 
(αρχαιολογία)</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Sombras de Carolina del Norte más allá de 
(archaeology)</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">In their study of artifact and lifeway pictures, students will observe and discuss past Native American lifeways and construct a timeline of four major culture periods in Native American Social Sciences. This unit is based on Lesson 4.1</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">In ihrer Studie des Kunstprodukts und der lifeway 
Abbildungen, beobachten Kursteilnehmer und behandeln hinter 
gebürtigen amerikanischen lifeways und konstruieren ein timeline aus 
vier Hauptkulturperioden in den gebürtigen amerikanischen 
Sozialwissenschaften. Diese Maßeinheit basiert auf Lektion 4.1</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Dans leur étude d'objet façonné et d'images 
lifeway, les étudiants observeront et discuteront après les lifeways
américains indigènes et construiront une chronologie avec de quatre 
périodes principales de culture en sciences sociales américaines 
indigènes. Cette unité est basée sur la leçon 4.1</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Em seu estudo do artifact e de retratos lifeway, 
os estudantes observarão e discutirão após lifeways americanos 
nativos e construirão um timeline de quatro períodos principais da 
cultura em ciências sociais americanas nativas. Esta unidade é
baseada na lição 4.1</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Nel loro studio sul manufatto e sulle immagini 
lifeway, gli allievi osserveranno e discuteranno oltre i lifeways 
americani natali e costruiranno un timeline con quattro periodi 
importanti della coltura nelle scienze sociali americane natali. 
Questa unità è basata sulla lezione 4.1</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Στη μελέτη τους χειροποίητου αντικειμένου και 
lifeway εικόνων, οι σπουδαστές θα παρατηρήσουν και θα 
συζητήσουν τα προηγούμενα εγγενή αμερικανικά lifeways και θα 
κατασκευάσουν μια υπόδειξη ως προς το χρόνο τεσσάρων σημαντικών 
περιόδων πολιτισμού στις εγγενείς αμερικανικές κοινωνικές 
επιστήμες. Αυτή η μονάδα είναι βασισμένη στο μάθημα 4,1</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">En su estudio del artefacto y de cuadros lifeway, 
los estudiantes observarán y discutirán más allá de lifeways 
americanos nativos y construirán un timeline de cuatro períodos 
importantes de la cultura en ciencias sociales americanas nativas. 
Esta unidad se basa en la lección 4.1</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD

          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>

          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>

          </contribute>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>

            <string language="x-t-cc-url">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/</string>
            <string language="en">Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>107682</entry>
    </identifier>

      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/shadows-of-north-carolinas-past-archaeology</uri>
